abstracts.cdata!:
The credit would support the third phase
            of the Government's adjustment program for addressing
            key macro-economic and sectoral issues facing Togo over the
            medium term. The objective of the program would be to
            achieve a sustained level of growth of close to five percent
            per annum by the early 1990's. The major elements of
            the program are flexible agricultural producer pricing in
            response to world market conditions, a new industrial
            incentive system complementing the enterprise privatization
            effort and a new legal framework for the parastatal sector.
            Further to this, the program would promote transparency in
            public enterprise accounts, reforms in fiscal policy to
            replace structurally the agricultural and phosphate taxation
            of former years, and a strengthened public investment
            program. To achieve these objectives, detailed action
            programs for agriculture, industry and commerce, parastatal
            sector management and public resource management would be
            implemented. Further, the Government would seek debt
            rescheduling on favorable terms as a pre-condition for
            mobilizing non-project concessional aid to meet its external
            financing requirements.
